oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pesticide and mycotoxin contamination of organic products and strategies for prevention
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wyss, Gabriela
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Consumers generally expect organic food to be produced ecologically and in a way in which they can trust. They further expect it to be healthy, and not or less contaminated with pesticides and/or mycotoxins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Wyss, Gabriela (2004) Pesticide and mycotoxin contamination of organic products and strategies for prevention. In: Proceedings of the First World Congress on Organic Food. Meeting the Challenges of Safety and Quality for Fruits, Vegetables, and Grains..
